value.title: Ethical framework crucial to cope with fast growth of AI: finance minister
value.excerpt: An ethical framework on the use of technologies must be newly defined side by side with fast-growing artificial intelligence (AI) that is reshaping the era of digital transformation, Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Economy and Finance Choo Kyung-ho said,

value.title: GCC Attorneys General approve use of Artificial Intelligence ethics document
value.excerpt: The document aims to establish a regulatory framework for the ethical use of AI in the work of attorney general offices

value.title: Generative AI is everything, everywhere, all at once
value.excerpt: Many notable tech companies are building their own large language models, whether it's Microsoft's Bing, Google's Bard, Snapchat's AI chatbot, or the new Meta AI chatbots. Generative AI is projected to balloon to a $1.32 billion market by 2032, according to a report by Bloomberg Intelligence .

value.title: Why Everyone Has A Role In Creating AI Ethics Standards
value.excerpt: As AI steadily integrates into our daily lives, ethical dilemmas have come to the forefront. I firmly believe that this duty extends beyond government boundaries; it's a shared responsibility encompassing each and every one of us, especially business leaders working with or on AI technology.

value.title: Democratizing AI with digital adoption platforms
value.excerpt: Digital adoption platforms learn application usage patterns and user behaviors and walk workers through business processes in real time, offering guidance and automating tasks. They can help all of us get the most from AI.

value.title: Challenges in implementing 'normative' AI guidelines, say researchers
value.excerpt: Reviewing global guidelines around the use of AI, researchers found that while most of the guidelines valued privacy, transparency, and accountability, very few valued truthfulness, intellectual property, or children's rights.

value.title: Researchers measure global consensus over the ethical use of AI
value.excerpt: To examine the global state of AI ethics, a team of researchers performed a systematic review and meta-analysis of global guidelines for AI use. The researchers found that while most of the guidelines valued Privacy,

value.title: Digital Awareness In The Age Of AI, Metaverse And Quantum Computing
value.excerpt: As we transition into an era defined by AI, the metaverse and quantum computing, digital awareness emerges as a critical skill set.

value.title: Navigating Ethical AI And The Future Of Automation
value.excerpt: As we traverse the landscape of AI and automation, we must ensure that our journey is guided by ethical principles.

value.title: Addressing Ethical Issues in Integrating AI Systems: Expert Opinion of Intetics CEO and President
value.excerpt: In the new article, Intetics CEO and President examines the consequences of the integration of AI and ethics. By referring to Isaac Asimov's Three Laws of Robotics, the importance of ethical concerns in AI and the conflicts that may arise from them are ...

value.title: AI ethics & usage study takes place
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence. It's a tool of the future, but it's here today. How do we reign in something so new that most people don't understand it yet?

value.title: Exclusive: Southeast Asia eyes hands-off AI rules, defying EU ambitions
value.excerpt: Reuters reviewed a confidential draft of the 10-member Association of Southeast Asian Nations' (ASEAN) "guide to AI ethics and governance," whose content has not previously been reported.

value.title: Fearing AI, fanfiction writers lock their accounts

value.title: AI bias poses danger to the financial sector, Bank of England warns
value.excerpt: A new report from a financial technology expert at the Bank of England says that inherent biases in AI systems makes it dangerous to entrust them with too much decision-making at present.

value.title: People And AI: ADP Is Hot In Automations For Payroll And Workforce
value.excerpt: We've talked a lot about this and related topics, and looked at AI's effect on the business world from any number of angles.

value.title: OpenAI's 'unreasonable claims' exhaust AI-ethics researchers
value.excerpt: Ethics researchers are struggling to keep up with the generative-AI boom as critiquing existing tech hinders the creation of more-responsible AI.

value.title: Most people the support need for trustworthy and regulated AI
value.excerpt: New research outlines the benefits and risks of AI - and shows how people in different coutries have varied perceptions on the impact of regulations and governance.

value.title: AI: we may not need a new human right to protect us from decisions by algorithms – the laws already exist

value.title: New Jersey Establishes Artificial Intelligence Task Force
value.excerpt: Gov. Phil Murphy signed an executive order Tuesday charging the task force with studying artificial intelligence and recommending government actions to support ethical use of the rapidly evolving technology.

value.title: Deloitte: Many Organizations Don’t Know If They Have Ethical Standards for Using Generative AI
value.excerpt: According to this 2023 State of Ethics and Trust in Technology report, 57% of respondents think cognitive technologies are most likely to pose a serious ethical risk.

value.title: 56% of professionals are unsure if their companies have ethical guidelines for AI use
value.excerpt: According to survey respondents in Deloitte's second edition Technology Trust Ethics Report, cognitive technologies such as generative AI have the most potential for both social good and serious ethical risk.

value.title: UNESCO And The Netherlands Launch Initiative To Ensure Ethical Oversight Of AI
value.excerpt: Dubbed Supervising AI by Competent Authorities, the initiative will see UNESCO assemble a report on current AI supervisory practices across Europe.

value.title: Global AI ethics framework needed to enshrine rules of a ‘good corporate citizen’
value.excerpt: It followed hot on the heels of another regulation leader, the European Union, which was the first to roll out laws on ethics in AI, including the proper use of data, the removal of biases ...

value.title: AI firms working on “constitutions” to keep AI from spewing toxic content
value.excerpt: Anthropic has published its own AI constitution, rules compiled by company leadership that draw from DeepMind’s published principles, as well as external sources like the UN Declaration of Human Rights, Apple’s terms of service, and so-called “non-Western perspectives.”

value.title: AI Is Not Your Enemy: Why Unfounded Fears Around AI Are Putting Organizations At Risk
value.excerpt: While it is important to acknowledge legitimate concerns surrounding AI, like safety, privacy and equitable access, it is equally crucial to recognize that extreme AI alarmists are inadvertently doing a disservice to society. They are turning people away from a transformative technology that could vastly benefit both industries and individuals.

value.title: Customized test benchmarks and openness crucial as generative AI models evolve
value.excerpt: As generative artificial intelligence (AI) models continue to evolve, industry collaboration and customized test benchmarks will be crucial amid organizations' efforts to establish the right fit for their business.

value.title: Why Your CEO Needs An AI Education — Now
value.excerpt: CEOs, CFOs, CHROs, and COOs should also become well-versed in the power and potential of AI, Sohigian adds. “They can provide comprehensive thinking around employee experience, business agility, privacy and security, and openness through integration and extensibility."

value.title: IBM Enables Safe Enterprise AI with Granite Foundation Models
value.excerpt: With its just-released Granite foundation models, IBM takes a big step towards addressing enterprise requirements for generative AI.
